publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Siŋgimduring T II S 79.3

seg.seg: For therein you will find pleasure, not in study.
ayant trouvé du plaisir dans le fait d'être utile à autrui.

list.item: a1 /// ·ñ· – ylñ· yairo_ṣ\ : yatsi śam(ts)i – ·[w]· c· ñci wi ·_ṣ· /// a2 /// y[kn]e : 10-8 lareṃ śaultsa śī_l\ pāssi nwi (śau)ltsa warñai : ce teykne[sa] – mñe nau /// a3 /// śka pl[ā]ma : tune ṅke twe wīna _k_allā_t\ mā= klyilñene 10-9 pelaiknenta pāke yāmtsi campn e /// a4 /// _r\ wnolmeṃt_s\ : alyekepi pruccamñene _k_al[pau] wīna : se ārth\ trīce patākne tne _k_arsanalle 20 snai /// a5 /// : _m_akte ypentse wpelm= auñento [ṣ]pa_k\ wāpatsi_ś\ : (ma)[n_t\] saṃsārne pi_ś\ antseṣṣi skainaṃ tne kleś yāmorṣṣe ña[r·] /// a6 /// c(m)elṣe wpelm= auñe(nt)ai [y·] – – – [_r\] : pi_ś\ c(m)e – – – – – – _t_anmas(k)eṃ[_t_a_r\] : kleś yāmor[ṣ](ṣ)e ñare _s_a /// b1 /// w(e)s_t_a_r\ snai wp[e]lm· – – – – wn(o)lme(ṃ)t_s\ – – – – – – [ha]nteṃt_s\ : [k]_us(e) tn(e) ṣarmo w· – ·w(a)rñ[ai] _ṣ_a /// b2 /// nta yāmn aiśaumye : ot aknātsañä\ pelaiknenta ca [·e] aiśsi : 20-3 emalyaisa memyo_ṣ\ _r_askre wnolmi tā[kaṃ] /// b3 /// wīna om_p\ skwaṃñen_t_a_r\ : kes_t\ yokaisa [m]emyo_ṣ\ wnolmi śwātsi yoktsi_ś\ : kawāṃñen_t_a_r tu[n]e /// b4 /// k_use tekisa memyu tākaṃ _p_arskau śaultsa : cwī saṃtkenta śle_k\ saṃtkīnau ñāssa ñṣalle : k_use lal· /// b5 /// _m_ṣ_aṃ skwantse ṣarma : 20-5 man_t(\) kreñcä\ w(n)olmi po cmelasa _p_arsko_ṣ\ (_r_a)skre : a /// b6 /// l(·)e – śyaine yku karā_ś\ wrocce – – yol[m]e [kro] ··ṃ ///
a3 For therein you will find pleasure, not in study. a4 ayant trouvé du plaisir dans le fait d'être utile à autrui.

a1 #M12a# /// %8 ·ñ· ; %2 – ylñ· yairoṣ : #18a yatsi śam(ts)i ; – ·w· c· ñci wi ·ṣ· %6 /// #18b a2 %12 #18c %11 /// ykne : 10-8 #18d lareṃ śaultsa ; śīl pāṣtsi|pāssi nwi ; (śau)ltsa warñai : #19a ce teyknesa ; – mñe nau %2 ; /// %4 #19b a3 %8 ; %1 /// śka plāma : #19c tune ṅke twe ; wīna källāt ; mā|m= āklyilñene 10-9 #19d pelaiknenta ; pāke yāmtsi ; campn e /// %2 #20a a4 %8 /// ; %2 r onolmeṃts|wnolmeṃts : #20b alyekepi ; pruccamñene ; kälpau wīna : #20c se ārth trice|trīce ; patākne tne ; kärsanalle 20 #20d snai /// a5 %11 /// : #21a mäkte ypentse ; wpelm= auñento ; ṣpak wāpatsiś : #22b (ma)nt saṃsārne ; piś antseṣṣi ; skainaṃ tne #21c kleś yāmorṣṣe ; ñar· /// %3 ; a6 %4 #21d /// %2 c(m)elṣe ; wpelm= auñe(nt)ai ; y· – – – r %4 : #22a piś c(m)e – – %2 ; – – – – %4 ; tänmas(k)eṃtär : #22b kleś yāmorṣ(ṣ)e ; ñare sä /// %5 #22c b1 %6 /// w(e)stär ; snai wpelm· – – %2 #22d – – %2 onolmeṃts|wn(o)lme(ṃ)ts – – – – %4 ; – – %2 hanteṃts : #23a k_us(e) tn(e) ṣarm|ṣarmo ; w· – %2 ·w(a)rñai ; ṣä /// %3 #23b b2 %7 /// nta ; yāmn aiśaumye : #23c ot aknātsañ ; pelaiknenta ; ca ·e aiśsi : 20-3 #23d emalyaisa ; memyoṣ räskre ; onolmi|wnolmi tākaṃ #24a /// b3 %6 /// wīna ; omp skwaṃñentär : #24b kest yokaisa ; memyoṣ onolmi|wnolmi ; śwātsi yoktsiś : #24c kawāṃñentär ; tune %2 ; /// b4 %4 /// #24d k_use tekisa ; memyu tākaṃ ; pärskau śaultsa : #25a cwi|cwī saṃtkenta ; ślek saṃtkīnau ; ñāssa ñṣalle : #25b k_use lal· %2 ; /// b5 %8 #25c %7 /// mṣäṃ ; skwantse ṣarma : 20-5 #25d mant kreñc onolmi|w(n)olmi ; po cmelasa ; pärskoṣ (rä)skre : #26a a /// %3 ; b6 %8 #26b %3 /// l(·)e ; – śyaine yku ; karāś orocce|wrocce #26c – – %2 yolme ; kro ··ṃ %3 /// ; %4 #26c

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a3 For therein you will find pleasure, not in study. ([[Adams, DoT]]: 38) 293
b2-5 If the beings are harshly tormented by heat … pleasure … there they are happy. Tormented by hunger and thirst the beings long for food and drink. Therein … Whoever may be tormented by illness [and] fears for his life, he has to search eagerly for medicine and a doctor. Whoever has exerted himself … he does … for the sake of happiness. Thus the good beings are terribly afraid throughout the births. (cf [[Adams, DoT]]: 91; [[Schmidt KT 1974]]: 69, 146; [[Thomas 1957]]: 262; 1970: 267; 1979c: 162; [[Carling 2000]]: 242) 714

Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
b3 Von Hunger [und] Durst gequält, verlangen die Wesen nach Essen [und] Trinken/verlangt es die Wesen nach Essen [und] Trinken/verlangen die Wesen für sich nach Essen [und] Trinken/verlangen die Wesen heftig nach Essen [und] Trinken. 69, 146

a5 tne kleś: Sieg & Siegling 1953 have tne • kleś. (I can't check that because the images from IDP do not load, again!) –Martin (Sat, 2020-03-14, 03:25)
